348.article_body: Seven persons, including an elderly patient on oxygen, were allegedly stuck for an hour in the lift of Shalby Hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Thursday. "We boarded the lift from...ninth floor and it got stuck on...tenth floor," a visitor said, adding, that the patient faced breathing difficulties. The hospital however claimed that the lift was opened in five minutes.

349.title: I-T official dies after SUV crashes head-on with her scooter in MP
349.article_body: A 59-year-old income tax official died after an SUV collided with her scooter head-on in MP's Bhopal on Thursday, police said. The victim, Sunita Chouhan, sustained severe head injuries after the crash and died in hospital during treatment. Police have obtained a picture of the car and are currently looking for the driver who fled after the accident.

350.title: He said 'just 1 kiss?': Another woman accuses Vijay Babu of sexual misconduct
350.article_body: After an actress accused Malayalam actor Vijay Babu of raping her, another woman has come forward to accuse him of behaving inappropriately with her in 2021. "[Vijay and I] met for a work-related thing...Suddenly he leaned to kiss me on my lips...without any consent," she alleged. "I pulled myself backwards...he then asked me 'Just one kiss?' I...said no," she added.

351.title: 18,000 kg of chicken nuggets from overturned truck closes US highway; pic surfaces
351.article_body: A highway in the US was closed for several hours this week after a tractor-trailer overturned and spilled chicken nuggets onto the road. Police say the tractor-trailer was carrying 40,000 pounds (over 18,000 kg) of frozen nuggets when the driver lost control. The driver was not injured. Crews remained on the scene for hours to clean up the chicken.

352.title: Gadkari inaugurates 12 National Highway projects worth ₹8,000 crore in Hyd
352.article_body: Union Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday inaugurated 12 National Highway (NH) projects worth ₹8,000 crore and seven Central Road Infrastructure Fund (CRIF) projects in Hyderabad. The NH projects, with a combined length of 460 km, will boost inter-state connectivity by enabling seamless travel from Telangana to Maharashtra, Karnataka and Andhra Pradesh.

353.title: Shah Faesal will serve same govt that imprisoned him: Omar Abdullah
353.article_body: Former J&K CM and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Friday congratulated former IAS officer Shah Faesal on his return to the government service. He, however, added that Faesal will now be serving the same government that imprisoned him. Faesal, who had quit the government service in 2019 citing 'rising intolerance' in India, was detained after Article 370 was abrogated.

354.title: Bengaluru police arrest 4 drug peddlers, seize ganja worth ₹1.5 lakh
354.article_body: The Central Crime Branch of Bengaluru police have arrested four Kerala-based drug peddlers, the city's Joint Commissioner of Police (Crime), Raman Gupta, said on Thursday. Police have recovered 2 kilograms of ganja, which is estimated to be worth around ₹1.5 lakh, from their possession. Further, police have also recovered four mobile phones and an electronic weighing machine from their possession.

355.title: Russian submarine strikes Ukrainian targets with cruise missiles
355.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry has said that a Russian submarine in the Black Sea carried out missile strikes against Ukrainian military targets. The ministry also released a video of Kalibr cruise missiles being launched from the sea. Notably, this is the first time Russia has announced the use of its submarine fleet to hit Ukrainian targets, according to reports.

356.title: Lt General BS Raju appointed as new Vice Chief of Army Staff
356.article_body: Lieutenant General BS Raju has been appointed as the new Vice Chief of Army Staff. Lt General Raju is currently serving as the Director-General of Military Operations. The appointment is reportedly a rare instance of an officer who's not been an Army Commander, getting appointed as the Vice Chief. He will take charge on May 1.

357.title: I don't like watching my films as I feel I could've done better: Ajay Devgn
357.article_body: Actor Ajay Devgn said he doesn't like watching his films after a few months of release as he feels he could have done better. The actor, who recently appeared in 'RRR' and 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said he hasn't watched either of the films. "I feel like I must have done terrible work and I don't want to watch it," Ajay added.

358.title: Papa said 'you'll find mother dead when you return': Daughters on UP BJP leader's death
358.article_body: After BJP leader Shweta Singh Gaur's dead body was found in her room in Uttar Pradesh's Banda, her daughters accused their father Deepak Singh Gaur, grandfather and other family members of murder. "Papa said that when you come back from school, you will find your mother dead...He wanted a son...They killed my mother," the daughters said.

359.title: Benedict Cumberbatch to host Ukrainian family who fled amid Russian invasion
359.article_body: Benedict Cumberbatch, in an interview with Sky News, confirmed that he's welcoming a Ukrainian family, who fled amid the Russian invasion, to his UK home. "I want to give them some stability after the turmoil that they've experienced...that's within my home," Cumberbatch said. The actor also revealed that he is helping other refugees by covering their housing costs in UK.

360.title: Australia squad for Sri Lanka series announced, Cummins rested for T20Is
360.article_body: Test captain Pat Cummins has been rested from the T20I squad from Australia's all-format tour of Sri Lanka in June and July. Marcus Harris, opener in four out of five Tests in Ashes series, was dropped from the Test squad. Spinner Adam Zampa will miss the tour as he's awaiting fatherhood. Tour comprises three T20Is, five ODIs and two Tests.

361.title: World no. 7 Ruud beats Molcan to reach BMW Open quarter-finals
361.article_body: World number seven Casper Ruud on Thursday beat Alex Molcan 3-6, 6-4, 6-4 to reach the quarter-finals of the BMW Open in Munich. "It was a very tough test. I didn't get off to a great start," Ruud said. "It gives me confidence I am able to win matches like these," he added. Ruud, 23, reached the semi-finals last year.

362.title: Cristiano Ronaldo scores to help Man Utd draw 1-1 with Chelsea in PL
362.article_body: Cristiano Ronaldo scored to help Manchester United draw 1-1 with Chelsea in the Premier League on Thursday. Ronaldo scored in the 62nd minute after Marcos Alonso gave Chelsea the lead in the 60th minute. Chelsea are currently third on the Premier League table with 66 points in 33 games. Chelsea will face Everton next in the Premier League on Sunday.

363.title: China to allow 'some' Indian students' return after India suspends Chinese visas
363.article_body: China will permit some Indian students to return for their studies, over two years after visa and flight restrictions were imposed due to COVID-19, the country's Foreign Ministry has said. "China attaches high importance to Indian students' concerns about returning," it added. This came after India suspended Chinese nationals' tourist visas, following its refusal to let Indian students return.

364.title: 64 villagers booked for killing leopard, attacking public servants in UP
364.article_body: As many as 64 people, including 10 women, were booked in connection with the killing of a three-year-old leopard by villagers in Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary in Uttar Pradesh's Bahraich, police said. The incident took place after the leopard allegedly injured 13 villagers inside the sanctuary. The accused also allegedly attacked public servants and obstructed government work, the DFO said.

365.title: Pankaj remembers Irrfan on death anniversary, says 'I've only watched his films'
365.article_body: Remembering Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary, Pankaj Tripathi said, "I get emotional every time I'm asked to talk about him." "Be it for craft, intellect, on-screen and off-screen behaviour, how to view acting, he has inspired everyone immensely," he said, adding, "When he acted, it made us take note of how he did it...I've only watched Irrfan's films."

366.title: 31-yr-old key accused in Jahangirpuri violence sent to 2-day police custody
366.article_body: A Delhi court has sent Fareed alias Neetu, one of the main accused in Jahangirpuri violence, to two-day police custody. Delhi Police Crime Branch had arrested 31-year-old Fareed from West Bengal. Police have alleged that he's "one of the conspirators" and was "seen firing at the other community" during the clashes that erupted during a Hanuman Jayanti rally in Jahangirpuri.

367.title: Assam court grants bail to Guj MLA Mevani in policewoman assault case
367.article_body: An Assam court has granted bail to Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani in a case of alleged assault on a policewoman. "He is likely to be released...[on Saturday]," Mevani's legal counsel Angshuman Bora said. Notably, Mevani was re-arrested in the assault case on Monday just after being granted bail in another case related to alleged objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi.

368.title: Shahid, Ishaan could've turned losers after my failed marriages: Mom Neliima
368.article_body: Neliima Azeem, mother of Shahid Kapoor and Ishaan Khatter, said, "My sons...[faced] a lot of challenges because, unfortunately, both my marriages failed." "I was extremely busy with (work)...I was bread earner...There were ups and downs," she said, adding, "My children shone through it all. For that, I give them an extra badge, because they...could've been losers also because of it."

369.title: If Umran remains hell bent on not reducing his pace, it won't work: Munaf
369.article_body: Ex-India pacer Munaf Patel said it "won't work" if SRH pacer Umran Malik remains "hell bent" on not reducing his pace at any cost. "You have to bowl in our conditions which are not ideal for fast bowling," added Munaf. "If he can focus more on line and length like Dale Steyn...then no one can stop him," stated Munaf.

370.title: Sidhu lauds Punjab govt as it frees 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali
370.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu lauded the Punjab government for freeing 29 acres of encroached land in Mohali. The land had been encroached on since 2007, the Department of Rural Development and Panchayats said. "My accolades to Panchayat Minister Kuldeep Dhaliwal...This is the way forward for Punjab...seize properties of...illegal...occupants, no matter who they are," Sidhu tweeted.

371.title: Pune's Pataleshwar temple faces acute shortage of water
371.article_body: Pune's Pataleshwar cave temple is facing an acute shortage of water amid heat wave-like conditions in the city. The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has now requested the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) to provide a new water supply connection to the monument. "It has become difficult to manage the daily operations with the existing supply," an ASI official said.

372.title: He promised his mom he'll take them out of poverty: Ian Bishop on DC's Rovman Powell
372.article_body: Talking about Delhi Capitals (DC) batter Rovman Powell, Ian Bishop said, "He has come from humble beginnings. He promised his mom that he will take them out of poverty when he was still in secondary school." He added, "He is living that dream to do that." Rovman was bought by DC for ₹2.8 crore in the mega auction.

373.title: Not ready to move on: Babil remembers dad Irrfan on his death anniversary
373.article_body: Actor Babil Khan on Friday penned a post remembering his late father Irrfan Khan on his second death anniversary. "I'm not ready to move on...and I'm alright with the idea that...I will never be...You still breathe, in my thoughts," Babil wrote on Instagram while sharing a picture of the late actor. Irrfan was diagnosed with neuroendocrine cancer in 2018.

374.title: Liverpool’s Mohamed Salah named England’s Men’s Footballer of the Year
374.article_body: Liverpool's Mohamed Salah on Friday was named England's Men's Footballer of the Year in the annual vote by the Football Writers' Association (FWA). Salah got 48% of the votes ahead of Manchester City's Kevin De Bruyne and West Ham United's Declan Rice. Salah, 29, has registered 30 goals and 14 assists in 44 appearances for Liverpool this season.

375.title: Man gets 8 yrs rigorous imprisonment for raping deaf-mute girl in J&K
375.article_body: A court in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur convicted a man of raping a deaf and mute girl and sentenced him to 8 years of rigorous imprisonment on Thursday. The convict, Karnail Singh, had barged into the girl's house six years ago and gagged and raped her, the officials said. A fine of ₹35,000 has also been imposed on him.

376.title: Zomato shares hit all-time low, wipe out half of investor wealth in 4 months
376.article_body: Shares of Zomato hit an all-time low of ₹71.15 on Friday, slipping below the lower band of IPO price in nine months since its stock market debut. Zomato has wiped out almost half of its investors' wealth since January 3, when its stock hit a high of ₹142.45. The food delivery platform's shares are down more than 15% this month.

377.title: Tibet Prez compares Nehru's policy to that after 2014, blames Nehru's faith in China
377.article_body: Central Tibetan Administration President Penpa Tsering compared Jawaharlal Nehru's policy of recognising China's sovereignty over Tibet to that in India after 2014. Tsering said Nehru had "too much faith" in China and "he did what he thought was best for India". "I think India has changed his policy by not repeating that Tibet is part of [China]," he stated.

378.title: I won't question or beg the captain for the ball: KKR's Andre Russell
378.article_body: KKR all-rounder Andre Russell said he wants to contribute more with the ball for his team in IPL 2022, but won't "question or beg" captain Shreyas Iyer for the ball. "I think everyone knows how important these last couple of games are," added Russell. Russell has picked 10 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

379.title: Insurtech startup Turtlemint raises $120 mn, reportedly at $900 mn valuation
379.article_body: Insurtech platform Turtlemint has raised $120 million in a Series E round led by Amansa Capital, Jungle Ventures and Nexus Venture Partners. The platform has closed the current financing round reportedly at a $900-950 million valuation. The round also saw participation from new investors Vitruvian Partners and Marshall Wace, along with other existing investors.

380.title: Ajay would give 1 shot & go back to being director: Rakul on Runway 34
380.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about 'Runway 34' co-star and director Ajay Devgn, said, "He was taking care of so many things." "From setting up, doing rehearsals, picturing every angle, every light to ensuring everything was bang on, he was more of...director," Rakul said, adding, "Then he'd just come to give one shot in a second and go back to being...director."

381.title: I'm sure Rohit, Kohli will get back in form in IPL 2022: Ganguly
381.article_body: Speaking about Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's batting performance in ongoing IPL, BCCI President Sourav Ganguly said he's sure both will get back in form in the upcoming matches. MI captain Rohit has scored 153 runs from eight matches at an average of 19.13, while ex-RCB skipper Kohli has managed 128 in nine matches, averaging 16.00, so far.

382.title: Around 8,000 British troops to take part in exercises in Europe: UK
382.article_body: Britain's Ministry of Defence on Friday said around 8,000 British Army troops will take part in exercises across eastern Europe in one of the largest deployments since the Cold War. Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said British service personnel will join with NATO allies for exercises amid Russia's ongoing invasion of Ukraine, which began on February 24.

383.title: Pakistani 'Made in China' drone shot down by BSF troops in Punjab
383.article_body: A Pakistani quadcopter was shot down by BSF troops near Dhanoe Kalan in Punjab's Amritsar on Friday. The BSF said that troops deployed at the border intercepted the drone after they heard a buzzing sound of a suspected flying object entering India from Pakistan around 1.15 am. The 'Made in China' drone was recovered after an intensive search, it added.

384.title: 2 men killed, 3 others injured in collision between 2 cars in Pune
384.article_body: Two men were killed and three others were severely injured in a collision between two cars near Pune's Kavdipath toll plaza area. According to police, the accident took place when the driver of one of the cars rammed into the other car from the side. A case has been registered against the unidentified car driver for rash driving.

385.title: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals sent back since 2019: BSF report
385.article_body: Over 14,000 Bangladeshi nationals have been sent back from the Indo-Bangladesh border since 2019, a BSF report said. It said at least 9,233 Bangladeshis were held at International Border while trying to flee after their illegal stay. "At least 4,896 Bangladeshi nationals were held while trying to enter India between January 1, 2019 and April 28, 2022," BSF report added.

386.title: LIC likely to list shares on exchanges on May 17
386.article_body: The shares of Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) are likely to list on the stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which will be India's biggest ever, will open for subscription on May 4 and close on May 9. The government is expecting to raise ₹20,557 crore by diluting its 3.5% stake through the IPO.

387.title: CID arrests BJP's Divya Hagargi in Karnataka PSI recruitment scam
387.article_body: BJP leader Divya Hagargi was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) in connection with the Police Sub-Inspector (PSI) recruitment scam in Karnataka. Divya was reportedly caught from a hideout in Pune in Maharashtra. She runs Jnana Jyothi Institution which is an educational institution in Kalaburagi and was the 18th accused to be arrested in the case.

388.title: Open to buying if terms are right: Petroleum Minister on importing oil
388.article_body: Union Minister for Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said, India is open to buying oil from other countries as we've to look after our interests. "We're situated close to gulf countries like Iran which has lot of oil...We've energy relations with Russia, we buy crude from them but our total imports are not more than 0.2%," Puri added.

389.title: MP class 10, 12 board results released; 3.55 lakh class 10 students declared failed
389.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh Board of Secondary Education on Friday declared results for classes 10 and 12. The Class 10 pass percentage is 59.54% and Class 12 pass percentage is 72.72%. A total of 3,55,371 Class 10 candidates have been declared failed. The last time the pass percentage was recorded below 60% for MP Class 10 board exam was in 2017.

390.title: Naga Chaitanya to make OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'
390.article_body: Naga Chaitanya will make his OTT debut with Prime Video's Telugu series 'Dhootha'. The actor's first look from the series, which is a supernatural horror thriller, was shared by Amazon Prime Video on Thursday. "As [an] actor, we always crave for our work to get maximum exposure and on a platform like Prime Video, we get that exposure," Chaitanya said.

391.title: Tata aims to build 80,000 EVs this financial year: Reuters
391.article_body: Tata Motors plans to ramp up its EV production and produce nearly 80,000 EVs in the current financial year, Reuters reported. The firm built and sold 19,000 EVs in the last financial year. At present, Tata Motors reportedly accounts for 90% of EV sales in India. The firm announced plans last year to launch 10 EV models by March 2026.

392.title: Woman injured in celebratory firing in Delhi, accused son absconding
392.article_body: A 54-year-old woman sustained bullet injuries during a celebratory firing at a wedding function at Matangi Bhawan in Delhi's Chhattarpur mandir on Thursday. The accused, who is absconding, is the woman's son, police confirmed. The injured woman was unconscious and unresponsive when the police reached the hospital to take her statement, a doctor said.

393.title: Global COVID-19 cases, deaths continue to decline since end of March
393.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization said global COVID-19 cases and deaths continued to drop since the end of March 2022. WHO said during the week of April 18 through April 24, over 4.5 million cases and over 15,000 deaths were reported globally, which is a decrease of 21% and 20%, respectively when compared to the previous week.

394.title: Greater demand for Alphonso mangoes in US this year: Exporters
394.article_body: The mango exporters of India said that for the first time there is a greater demand for Alphonso mango in US this year, compared to the traditional Kesar mango. "At the start of the season, we were apprehensive and so export volumes were lower than usual. However, US consumers lapped up the mangoes which went from India," an exporter said.

395.title: Gurugram witnesses hottest April day in over 40 years at 45.6°C
395.article_body: Gurugram on Thursday witnessed its hottest day in April in over 40 years at 45.6 degrees Celsius, according to the India Meteorological Department data. Gurugram had recorded the highest maximum temperature of 44.8 degrees Celsius in the month of April in 1979. Notably, IMD has issued a heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram, for the next four days.

396.title: Chhavi Mittal shares pics with husband from hospital on anniversary, pens note
396.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently underwent a six-hour-long surgery for breast cancer, celebrated her 17th wedding anniversary with her husband, Mohit Hussein, in hospital on Friday. Sharing some pictures with Mohit, she wrote, "I would choose you 100 times over as my life partner because the way you have stuck with me through everything, I don't think anyone could've."

397.title: South Korea to lift outdoor mask mandate
397.article_body: South Korea will lift an outdoor mask mandate starting next week. Health authorities said people will still be required to wear masks at outdoor gatherings of over 50 people and sporting and cultural events with potentially large crowds. South Korea reported 50,568 new COVID-19 cases on Friday. The country had removed most of its COVID-19 restrictions earlier this month.

398.title: HC adjourns hearing of Umar Khalid's bail plea to May 6 in Delhi riots case
398.article_body: Delhi High Court on Friday adjourned Umar Khalid's bail plea hearing in connection with the 2020 Delhi riots case to May 6. "Section 124A of the Indian Penal Code is under challenge before the Supreme Court and is coming up for hearing on May 5. The findings on the 124A will have bearing on these cases as well," HC said.

399.title: Man hangs self after killing wife, 3-month-old daughter in UP's Bareilly
399.article_body: A 26-year-old man allegedly hanged himself after killing his 24-year-old wife and their three-month-old daughter in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly, police said. The incident came to light when the family members broke open the door when no one came out till late in the morning, police added. Prima facie it appears that the man died by suicide, police stated.

400.title: It was a tough start, but I was in form: Powell after win against KKR
400.article_body: Delhi Capitals batter Rovman Powell has said that he had to face a "tough start" during his match-winning knock of 33*(16) against KKR on Thursday. "Yeah, it was a tough start, but I was in form. In the early part of the season, I was going out for like one ball, two balls and those kinds of stuff," Powell said.
